TextView.android:text: This screen shows the requirements for each measurement method. Requirements include your position relative to the object, and which values must be calibrated.
Calibrate Eye Height: Object Height
Level ground (ground at your position must be at same altitude as ground at object's position).\nMeasuring vertical object.
Calibrate Eye Height: Object Length Inside
Level ground.\nMeasuring horizontal object.\nWhen one end of the object is directly in front of you, other end is directly behind you.
Calibrate Eye Height: Object Length Outside
Level ground.\nMeasuring horizontal object.\nWhen one end of the object is directly in front of you, other end is directly in front of you.
Calibrate Eye Height: Object Length Hypotenuse
Level ground.\nMeasuring horizontal object.\nWhen one end of the object is directly in front of you, other end is directly to your left or right side.
Calibrate Eye Height: Object Length Free
Level ground.\nMeasuring horizontal object.\nMagnetic Sensor functioning accurately (from the Welcome Screen, click Calibrate then Set Precision to see whether the sensor is working).
Calibrate Eye Height: Distance From You
Level ground.
Calibrate Eye Height: Two Other Eye Heights
Full Version purchased.\nEye Height #1 and #2 already set.
Calibrate Camera Height/Angle: Object Height, Object Length, Distance From You
Level surface (surface at phone's position must be same altitude as surface at object's position).\nBottom edge of phone on surface.
Measure Height

Eye Height #1 set to altitude of eyes relative to ground.
Level ground or matching incline (matching incline means ground sloped at an angle equal to the Incline Angle that you set).
If incline not set to 0, incline assumed to be your choice of either in direction of object or in direction when incline was set.
If using Magnetic Sensor to determine incline direction, Magnetic Sensor functioning accurately.
Measuring vertical object.
Measure Length: Parallel Inside

Eye Height #1 set to altitude of eyes relative to ground.
Level ground or matching incline.
If incline not set to 0, incline in direction of first point. Second point would have opposite incline.
When one end of the object is directly in front of you, other end is directly behind you.
If incline set to 0, measuring horizontal object. If press-and-release on first step, measuring horizontal object. If press-and-hold on first step, measuring object on ground slanted at ground's incline.
Measure Length: Parallel Outside

Eye Height #1 set to altitude of eyes relative to ground.
Level ground or matching incline.
If incline not set to 0, incline in direction of first point. Second point would have same incline.
When one end of the object is directly in front of you, other end is directly in front of you.
If incline set to 0, measuring horizontal object. If press-and-release on first step, measuring horizontal object. If press-and-hold on first step, measuring object on ground slanted at ground's incline.
Measure Length: Hypotenuse

Eye Height #1 set to altitude of eyes relative to ground.
Level ground or matching incline.
If incline not set to 0, incline in direction of first point. Second point would have 0 incline.
When one end of the object is directly in front of you, other end is directly to your left or right side.
If incline set to 0, measuring horizontal object. If press-and-release on first step, measuring horizontal object. If press-and-hold on first step, measuring object on ground slanted at ground's incline.
Measure Length: Free

Eye Height #1 set to altitude of eyes relative to ground.
Level ground or matching incline.
If incline not set to 0, incline in direction you were facing when you set it.
If incline set to 0, measuring horizontal object. If press-and-release on first step, measuring horizontal object. If press-and-hold on first step, measuring object on ground slanted at ground's incline.
Magnetic Sensor functioning accurately.
Measure Length: Distance From You
Eye Height #1 set to altitude of eyes relative to ground.\nLevel ground or matching incline.\nIf incline not set to 0, incline in direction of point.
Measure Length: Perpendicular Inside

Eye Height #1 set to altitude of eyes relative to ground.
Level ground or matching incline.
If incline not set to 0, incline in direction of perpendicular point.
When facing the object perpendicular to its length, you're facing a point on the object.
Measuring horizontal object.
Measure Length: Perpendicular Outside

Eye Height #1 set to altitude of eyes relative to ground.
Level ground or matching incline.
If incline not set to 0, incline in direction of perpendicular point.
When facing the object perpendicular to its length, you're facing a point outside of the object.
Measuring horizontal object.
Measure From Two Heights: Parallel Inside

Full Version purchased.\nDifference between eye heights when measuring equals difference between Eye Height #1 and Eye Height #2.\nWhen one end of the object is directly in front of you, other end is directly behind you.
Measure From Two Heights: Parallel Outside

Full Version purchased.\nDifference between eye heights when measuring equals difference between Eye Height #1 and Eye Height #2.\nWhen one end of the object is directly in front of you, other end is directly in front of you.
Measure From Two Heights: Hypotenuse

Full Version purchased.\nDifference between eye heights when measuring equals difference between Eye Height #1 and Eye Height #2.\nWhen one end of the object is directly in front of you, other end is directly to your left or right side.
Measure From Two Heights: Free
Full Version purchased.\nDifference between eye heights when measuring equals difference between Eye Height #1 and Eye Height #2.\nMagnetic Sensor functioning accurately.
Measure From Two Heights: Distance From You
Full Version purchased.\nDifference between eye heights when measuring equals difference between Eye Height #1 and Eye Height #2.
Measure From Two Heights: Perpendicular Inside

Full Version purchased.\nDifference between eye heights when measuring equals difference between Eye Height #1 and Eye Height #2.\nWhen facing the object perpendicular to its horizontal length, you're facing a point on the object.
Measure From Two Heights: Perpendicular Outside

Full Version purchased.\nDifference between eye heights when measuring equals difference between Eye Height #1 and Eye Height #2.\nWhen facing the object perpendicular to its horizontal length, you're facing a point outside of the object.
Measure From Two Positions: Parallel

Full Version purchased.
Two positions separated by distance equal to set Stride Distance.
Stride directly toward or away from first point.
When one end of the object is directly in front of you, other end is directly either in front of or behind you.
Each point must be either in front of you from both positions or behind you from both positions. Changing positions must not cause a point that was in front you to now be behind you, or vice versa.
Measure From Two Positions: Perpendicular

Full Version purchased.
Two positions separated by distance equal to set Stride Distance.
Stride directly toward or away from first point.
When facing the first point, the second point must be directly to either the left or right side of the first point.
Measure From Two Positions: Free
Full Version purchased.\nTwo positions separated by distance equal to set Stride Distance.\nMagnetic Sensor functioning accurately.
Measure From Two Positions: Object Positions
Full Version purchased.\nEye Height #1 set to eye height relative to ground.
Measure Camera: Height

Level surface or matching incline.
If incline not set to 0, incline in direction camera is facing.
Bottom edge of phone on surface.
Measuring vertical object.
Measure Camera: Length

Level surface or matching incline.
If incline not set to 0, incline in direction camera is facing.
Bottom edge of phone on surface.
Measuring object laying on surface, parallel to direction camera is facing.
Measure Camera: Width

Level surface or matching incline.
If incline not set to 0, incline in direction camera is facing.
Bottom edge of phone on surface.
Measuring object laying on surface, perpendicular to direction camera is facing.
Measure Camera: Distance From You
Level surface or matching incline.\nIf incline not set to 0, incline in direction camera is facing.\nBottom edge of phone on surface.
Measure Angle: Vertical
Measuring vertical angle.
Measure Angle: Free
Magnetic Sensor functioning accurately.
